definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: Catholics pray to Mary as an intercessor.
sentences.chinese: 天主教徒向玛利亚祈祷，并把她看作仲裁者。
她还跟那个异教徒一起么？

sentences.english: My mother is one of the Methodists.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲是卫理公会派教徒之一。

sentences.english: He saw few problems with the division of Protestants into more and smaller denominations.
sentences.chinese: 他看见几个问题与该司的新教徒更小面额的。

sentences.english: In the South, Methodists and Baptists joined hands in the movement.
sentences.chinese: 教徒和浸礼教徒在运动中携手合作。

sentences.english: In the South, Methodists and Baptists joined hands in the movement.
sentences.chinese: 教徒和浸礼教徒在运动中携手合作。

sentences.english: Catholics are agnostic to the Protestant creeds.
sentences.chinese: 天主教徒对于新教教义来说，是不可知论者。

sentences.english: Each settlement of the Pilgrims was a little piece of the Old World inserted into the New.
sentences.chinese: 每一处清教徒的居留地，都是嵌进新大陆的旧世界。

sentences.english: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Christ from the death.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒们庆祝耶稣基督的复活。

sentences.english: He was traveling in the Low Countries, and subsequently became acquainted with the Pilgrims' church in Leiden.
sentences.chinese: 他到低地国家旅行，随后与莱顿的清教徒教会相熟。

sentences.english: Conversely, Protestants often interpret the Old Testament scriptures more literally than Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 相反，新教教徒往往用更为书面的语言解释圣经旧约。

sentences.english: But this girl was a non-believer.
sentences.chinese: 况且，这个女子是一个异教徒。

sentences.english: Presidents have invariably also been Protestants and two-thirds of them have been college graduates.
sentences.chinese: 总统千篇一律是新教徒，而且三分之二是大学毕业生。

sentences.english: There is something sub-human about Hindus, they thrive in sh'it.
sentences.chinese: 有一些是印度教徒，他们在屎中茁壮成长。

sentences.english: He was a pagan … who worshiped idols .
sentences.chinese: 他以前是个拜偶像的异教徒。

sentences.english: Christians preponderate in the population of that part of the country.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒在该国的那一地区的人口中居多。
